Job Posting:173651 - Position: W26 Application Development 173651 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/01/2025 09:00 AM Through UBC Science Co-op 09/22/2025 11:12 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City ICBC Insurance Corporation of British Columbia 151 Esplanade W North Vancouver Postal Code / Zip Code V7M3H9 Province / State Country British Columbia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Application Development 173651 Co-op Position North Vancouver, BC Canada 4 or 8 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 37.5 Major List 34.23 + 11.2% in lieu of Stat/Vacation *Please fill out the Co-op questionnaire as a part of your application from the Additional Application Information * ICBC Co-Op Opportunity - Application Development A career at ICBC is an opportunity to be part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team that is driven to serve its customers and community. Make the most of your skills and take the opportunity to grow and develop your career. You can expect a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits and a challenging work environment. Drive your career with us. We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers. If you are a job seeker with a disability, please let us know so we can support you in delivering your best performance. Position Highlights Working as a member on one of ICBC's Application Development teams, you will be developing and managing solutions used by our Insurance, Claims, or Driver Licensing (based in Victoria) lines of business. You will work with industry-leading technologies, including SAP, Guidewire's suite and other Java-based platforms and be part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team in an environment that promotes growth and development. We are looking for a qualified co-op student who will: • Play a supporting role for development teams within IS Claims, Insurance or Driver Licensing Apps • Analyze P1 & P2 incidents of applications in production, and assist with post-incident reviews (PIR) • Gather and analyze user requirements for new application functionality • Develop web prototypes, system enhancements, big fixes or automation solutions • Create/update system documentation • Create/modify reporting solutions • Have an ability to work cooperatively within a team environment and other departments to provide support for data integration, data analysis and data visualization Pay: $34.23 per hour + 11.2% in lieu of Stat/Vacation Duration: 4 months with options to renew Job Requirements Position Requirements The ideal candidate will have the following: • Good understanding of client-server and web technologies • Good understanding of Java, .NET/C# (UNIX would be a bonus), and SQL database queries • Good understanding of standard web technologies and libraries (i.e., HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JQuery) • Good understanding of quality assurance practices relating to software development • Ability to work cooperatively within a team environment and other departments to provide support for data integration, data analysis and data visualization • Excellent inter-personal skills • Excellent communication/presentation skills • Excellent organizational and writing skills • Experience with version control tools (e.g. GitLab) Citizenship Requirement N/A Position Start Date Position End Date January 05, 2026 12:00 AM April 30, 2026 12:00 AM APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Cover Letter Required? Yes Special Application Instructions Please submit an additional PDF document answering the questions below: 1. "Persons with disabilities" means persons who have a long-term or recurring physical, mental, sensory, psychiatric, or learning impairment, and who a) consider themselves to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment, or b) believe that an employer or potential employer is likely to consider them to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment, and includes persons whose functional limitations owing to their impairment have been accommodated in their current job or workplace. Examples of what is considered a disability include, but are not limited to, the following impairments or issues relating to: Coordination or dexterity (difficulty using hands or arms); Mobility (difficulty moving around and may include severe back problems); Non-visible, physical conditions such as: heart problems, chronic pain, diabetes, epilepsy, asthma, glaucoma, and lupus; Hearing and visual; Speech, such as muteness; and difficulty speaking and being understood; Learning, such as: Dyslexia; Mental or psychiatric such as: depression and burn-out; A disability for which the employer provided an accommodation. Based on this definition, do you identify as a person with a disability? Yes or No We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers. If you are a job seeker with a disability, please let us know below what adjustments can be made to help support you in delivering your best performance: 1. Do you self-identify as Indigenous (First Nations, Inuit or Metis) as permitted under Paragraph 42 of the BC Human Rights Code? Yes or No 1. Please clarify your eligibility to work in Canada. If you are on a visa, specify the type, any associated restrictions, and the visa expiry date: I am eligible to work in Canada without limitations (e.g., Canadian citizen or permanent resident) I am eligible to work with certain limitations. Please select all applicable permits below and provide the necessary details: Study Permit (Student - Max 24 hours per week) - Expiry & restrictions: Co-op Work Permit - Expiry & restrictions: Open Work Permit - Expiry & restrictions: Closed Work Permit (Employer-specific) - Expiry & restrictions: I am not currently eligible to work in Canada 1. We require all students to return to their studies and complete at least one academic term following the conclusion of their co- op. Will you be meeting this requirement if you are hired for this position? Yes or No If this doesn't apply to you, please explain:
